34.heading: Defilice, Adam.
34.title: Sandra Chang's Akemi : also presenting Adam Defelice's Starkstrom.
34.author: [No author]
notes: (Buccaneer Books Sneak Preview)

Akemi: "A futuristic multilevel city solves its population explosion through an unjust caste system. Akemi, born of the worker class, must live her life in poverty. Desiring creative freedom, she unwittingly becomes involved with a band of deviants plotting a revolution."

Starkstrom: "In the near future, multinational conglomerates control global affairs through corporate espionage and assassination. Major Dalin Cross heads the Starkstrom Black Ops unit until his team is wiped out by the new state of the art, Cyber Ninja Squad."

88.heading: Deformity.
88.title: "Freak Show"
88.author: written by Bruce Jones ; illustrated by Berni Wrightson ; colored by Michelle Wrightson
88.appears_in: p. 11-16 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 6 (Sept. 1982).
notes: "The story so far: A brightly decorated wagon pulled into a small town at the height of a severe rain storm. The driver, a gaunt figure in black, began to tell the townspeople of a similar person who, years earlier, undertook the 'collecting' of lonely and deformed people, the lost children of the world."
To be continued.

89.heading: Deformity.
89.title: "Freak Show"
89.author: by Bruce Jones ; illustrated by Berni Wrightson
89.appears_in: p. 81-89 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 8 (Nov. 1982).
notes: "The story so far: The townspeople continued to listen to the mysterious stranger's tale of Valker and his wretches. Valker had awakened from a drunken stupor, hoping to see his newborn child for the first time. He beheld a horribly deformed baby girl, and became enraged."
"To be continued."
